instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
this one come in for liquid spill but nothing on board got affected. turns out power on but lcd dead. ordered one supplier sent 2015 lcd. so i put another working lcd (belongs to my machine) boot up and everything working but serial is unavailable. I plugged in medusa and to read bios put it over to pc wrote serial back and no boot. I tried clean bios same issue.

what am i doing wrong. can anyone help.

the only one strange thing i can see is the production date looks messed up.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
Medusa has a fix checksum option; try it after serial was changed.
I hope you verified backup has been correctly read.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: when i select fix in medusa it throws error fsys block not found...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
You've probably wrote bad BIOS back to MLB.
Or got an error reading original chip.
Always verify first reading against original chip.
You may now need to build new BIOS dump...
Upload the dump actually flashed on the MLB.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: Hey informaticos, thanks for your help I rewrote the bios again, was chiming bot still no boot, then I re-wrote serial then fix ME region but now booting working and serial is back!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
Glad to hear that.

Remember, always verify the first reading for a backup BIOS.
Never erase/flash the chip before assure a correct reading!!!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: thanks for your advice!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: hey guys this Macbook has lost its serial again??? any ideas why?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
Write the good BIOS dump in other chip.
Test it few days and let us know...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: i was just playing around with it and tried pram and serial disappeared again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: SPI ROM chip might be bad/damaged. Try with a new/different chip and see how it does.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
OK so i inspected around spi rom chip and im missing <RESISTOR>R6131</RESISTOR>.

EDIT: checked another board and it is probably no stuff but it doesnt say on schematics - got rolled

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
Schematic specifies <SIGNAL>DUAL_IO</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>QUAD_IO</SIGNAL> versions.
<RESISTOR>R6131</RESISTOR> is for <SIGNAL>QUAD_IO</SIGNAL>, which was for testing purposes, not implemented in that MLB.

As I told before, change <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> with another chip.
This way you can discard an internal issue...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: Changed bios, programmed serial. everything working. i do pram reset again serial is gone!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: anyone????

threads.message: What is your serial number?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: sent via pm thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message: Did you fix Fsys checksum after serial was changed?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a serial unavailable.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 45461"]Did you fix Fsys checksum after serial was changed?[/QUOTE]

after i programmed serial serial was showing with unhappy face. I then fixed fsys and got the smiley face. everything else was good vss fsys serial. again boot to os. serial everything displays fine. i do a few resets ... serial disappears.
